TopicTitle: KSP Interstellar Extended Continued Development Thread

Articles.Content:
2 hours ago, FreeThinker said:

@Swedishish It appears  the thermal helper doesn't take into account Near Future mode, causing it  give wrong prediction. I can ensure you 4 of those sime foldable radiators should be enough for this reactor.

I see. Perhaps then those images didn't help. I am, however, still at a loss. On my test rigs, the reactor's output and subsequent transmission power do appear to scale with the thermal helper info. 

edit: Removing NF Electrics does appear to fix the problem. 

Edited January 22, 2017 by Swedishish

I'm getting ready to start a new save and have been thinking about including this mod to get access to some of the very end-game engines since I'd like to colonize several planets and they would help with that significantly. That said, I'm also a big fan of the Near-Future Technologies mods for what would end up being mid-game in this save, yet I've gathered from some searching through this thread that some serious balance issues crop up when using the two mods together. Am I correct in this assumption, or do they mesh well together?

Thanks.

6 hours ago, SpacedInvader said:

I'm getting ready to start a new save and have been thinking about including this mod to get access to some of the very end-game engines since I'd like to colonize several planets and they would help with that significantly. That said, I'm also a big fan of the Near-Future Technologies mods for what would end up being mid-game in this save, yet I've gathered from some searching through this thread that some serious balance issues crop up when using the two mods together. Am I correct in this assumption, or do they mesh well together?

Thanks.

KSPI-E was originaly designed to make KSPI work in a balanced way with Near Future Technology, so YES!

@FreeThinker Question which way does it balance, down to NFT or bring NFT up too KSPI-E.  Just started a career playthrough with your mod, havnt touched it since a few months after the fork (took a long ksp break), loving the updates!  More curious for the future in case I feel like added parts.

@FreeThinker Question which way does it balance, down to NFT or bring NFT up too KSPI-E.  Just started a career playthrough with your mod, havnt touched it since a few months after the fork (took a long ksp break), loving the updates!  More curious for the future in case I feel like added parts.

1 hour ago, FreeThinker said:

It balances KSPI power level down to NT level when NFE is installed...

This explains a few things that I have not been able to figure out. 

Also just ran into the RCS sound crashing bug the other day. Only to find out this was fixed in a recent patch. Why didn't AVC notify me of the update? Should I have checked it with CKAN?

On Monday, January 09, 2017 at 4:05 PM, falcoon said:

 I can still fully benefit from all Interstellar technologies (just values will be defferent)? It won't affect beam power network and it's efficiency?

Im running NFE with the reactor de-buffs in KSPIE. I have had no troubles with my beamed power network thus far. Keep in mind I'm only using microwave band in Kerbin's SOI for now but evrything is working beautifully. 

It does become a challenge to reach that 2.5GW needed for the DT Vista, but not impossile.

21 hours ago, Aaron Also said:

It does become a challenge to reach that 2.5GW needed for the DT Vista, but not impossile. 

1

Well note that the DT-Vista is quite forgiving as it will scales the maximum thrust generated based on amount of available power. Meaning, even if you have only 250 MW, it is still able to produce thrust at high Isp. The justification for this is that the Vista is technically an op Inertial Confinement Fusion Reactor which operates by very short burst of fusion. When you have less power than the requested power, it simply reduces the rate at which fusion explosions are taking place.

Edited January 24, 2017 by FreeThinker

Version 1.12.0 for Kerbal Space Program 1.2.2

Released on 2017-01-23

  • Added New ISRU Process: Atmosphere Extractor which allows extraction of useful resources from any Atmosphere (credits EvilGeorge)
  • Added Regolith Drill
  • Added Regolith to switchable solid storage tanks
  • Added Atmospheric definition for Galileo (credits Chase842)
  • Balance: Limited maximum Beamed power in Near Future Electric mode
  • Balance: Made Xenon fuel mode more electric efficient
  • Fixed Cleaned interface Beam Bower receiver when linked for relay
Edited January 24, 2017 by FreeThinker
I noticed with tweak scale that the thermal electric generator weighs the same no matter what the size, is that supposed to happen?
Is there a (simple) way to disable the changes made when Near Future is detected?

4 hours ago, cwal728 said:

I noticed with tweak scale that the thermal electric generator weighs the same no matter what the size, is that supposed to happen?

Yes, it is intended.

2 hours ago, LucidPixels said:

Is there a (simple) way to disable the changes made when Near Future is detected?

Yes, there is. Simply remove the UNI_NF_Mode.cfg file in Patches folder

Please ask any further question in the release thread.

Edited January 24, 2017 by FreeThinker
